author: draganrakita
content:
Just to state it, we have three slightly different types of EOF bytes:
1. EOF inside account, has full data section, used for execution.
2. EOF inside container section or transaction initcode, has full data and is used for creating new EOF. It uses RETURNCONTRACT, and makes STOP/RETURN abort execution.
3. EOF inside container of container, it is missing aux data.

author: draganrakita
content: so third type shouldn't be found inside container of first type. aka account EOF should not contain container with missing aux data.
